laboratory_examinations.findings: Aspartate amino-transferase level was 119 U per liter (normal range, 0 to 37); alanine aminotransferase level was 48 U per liter (normal range, 0 to 40); alkaline phosphatase and bilirubin levels were normal.

White-cell count was 3410 per cubic millimeter (56% neutrophils, 18% lymphocytes, 25% monocytes); hemoglobin level was 13.1 g per deciliter; platelet count was 127,000 per cubic millimeter; erythrocyte sedimentation rate was 37 mm per hour (normal range, 1 to 20); C-reactive protein level was 2.9 mg per deciliter (normal value, <0.5).
Serum phosphorus level was 3.9 mg per deciliter (normal range, 2.7 to 4.5 mg per deciliter).
Uric acid level was 5.7 mg per deciliter (normal range, 3.5 to 7.2 mg per deciliter).
Haptoglobin level was 55 mg per deciliter (normal range, 36 to 195).
Ferritin level was 508 ng per milliliter (normal range, 30 to 400).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 700 ng per milliliter two months later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: LDH level was 1942 U per liter (normal range, 118 to 273).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 2475 U per liter during the fourth month check.

laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 2800 per cubic millimeter; hemoglobin level was 11.3 g per deciliter; platelet count was 138,000 per cubic millimeter.
White-cell count was 1900 per cubic millimeter; hemoglobin level was 9.8 g per deciliter; platelet count was 44,000 per cubic millimeter.
